article.description: Will Bynum delivered with little more than a tick left on the clock to send Tech past OSU.
article.headline: Bynum's drive sends Jackets to finals
article.linkText: Georgia Tech stings Ok. State in final seconds

inlines.body:
Sutton Won't Retire ... Yet
SAN ANTONIO -- Oklahoma State coach Eddie Sutton will make another run for that elusive national title after confirming that he would return for his 15th season at his alma mater.

Sutton was coaching in his third Final Four on Saturday and there was speculation that he would retire if the Cowboys won the national title.

But Sutton was adamant that he's not going anywhere just yet.

"I plan on coming back next year,'' the 68-year old Sutton said. "We should have a really good team."

The Cowboys lose Big 12 player of the year Tony Allen, but are expected to return fellow senior Ivan McFarlin, who earned back his fourth year of eligibility. The other remaining starters are all back.

Sutton took Arkansas to the 1978 Final Four and Oklahoma State to a Final Four in 1995. He's never been to a national title game.

Sutton's son, Sean, is an associate head coach and is expected to be the successor when the elder Sutton retires.
-- Andy Katz, ESPN.com

Dick Vitale's Final Four Take
Wow, after three amazing games in the regional finals last week, it's incredible that we saw such a fantastic finish in the Georgia Tech-Oklahoma State national semifinal. In the end, junior guard Will Bynum won it for Georgia Tech on a gutsy game-winning drive. His quickness and penetration ability made all the difference in the closing seconds. Ironically, Bynum was supposed to transfer to Oklahoma State (from Arizona). But the Cowboys didn't have a scholarship available, so he wound up at Georgia Tech. What an incredible turn of events and what an awesome finish! Oklahoma State faced double-digit deficits in both the first and second halves, but the Cowboys battled and clawed back to a 65-65 tie on junior guard John Lucas' big 3-pointer with 25 seconds left. It looked like the game would go to OT, but the Yellow Jackets pulled it out in regulation on Bynum's tough layup.
More...

article.story: STILLWATER, Okla. (AP) -- Joey Graham scored 18 points in Oklahoma State's 80-63 exhibition victory over Global Sports on Saturday night. John Lucas and Jameson Curry each added 15 points for Cowboys. Chris Jeffries led Global Sports with 14 points.
